glosses: second-person singular negative imperative of kapamak

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish قپامه (ḳapama, “an act of shutting, closing, confining; a kind of coat or cloak closing in front; a kind of stew, prepared in a closed vessel”), from قپامق (ḳapamaḳ, “to close, to shut, to confine”), from Proto-Turkic *kapga-, from *kap- (“to close”), morphologically kapa- + -ma.
